summary: This is an email chain from a paralegal at the law firm Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, forwarding a request to file a letter under seal in the case U.S. v Tartaglione. The email is addressed to an Assistant U.S. Attorney and involves defense counsel for Nicholas Tartaglione.

persons.name: Jennifer Giambrone

persons.name: Donna Aldea
persons.context: Attorney at Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, retained counsel for Mr. Tartaglione, who authored a letter request to be filed under seal.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Named partner in the law firm Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, copied on the email.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Individual copied on the email regarding the case U.S. v Tartaglione.

connections.description: Both work at the same law firm, Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, with Giambrone as a paralegal supporting Aldea's legal work.
Both are attorneys and partners at the same law firm.
Both work at the same law firm, with Giambrone as a paralegal and Barket as a partner.

events.title: Request to File Under Seal in Tartaglione Case
events.description: Defense attorney Donna Aldea submits a letter request to be filed under seal in the criminal case U.S. v Tartaglione.

keyFacts: The email involves the law firm Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP, which was representing Nicholas Tartaglione in a federal criminal case.
The communication is a request to file a letter from defense counsel Donna Aldea under seal, indicating sensitive or confidential information.
The email highlights standard legal confidentiality practices, as it contains multiple warnings about privileged attorney-client communication.
The document is part of the Epstein case data set, suggesting a potential connection or relevance to the broader Jeffrey Epstein investigation, though the direct link is not stated in this text.
